text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to share
with you sort of my version of a Spanish
tortilla which is really like think of
it like a potato frittata almost it's
really easy to make by no means is this
authentic but it is really delicious and
I was inspired by one of my favorite
tapas restaurants in Philly so I figured
I had to recreate it and share it with
you and I think it's absolutely to die
for delicious and the ingredients are
very basic but this is sort of my
attempt and you're going to need some
chopped onion some potatoes which I'll
talk about in a minute I've got some
shredded Monterey Jack and cheddar which
I know it's not authentic but it is
delicious here some chopped up parsley
and some chives a little bit of smoked
paprika you need some eggs salt and
pepper and olive oil now traditionally
you'll use sliced potatoes and you make
sure that they're paper-thin which i
think is makes things a little bit
complicated I have seen it made with
cubed potatoes which is how I like to
make it so that's what I'm going with
today now what I like to do is I've just
taken these four potatoes and these are
rather small I put them in some cold
water in a pan brought it up to a boil
and boil them for five minutes and took
them out and I think cool completely
they're not even halfway cooked through
but they're about a third of the way
cooked through and that makes the
cooking a lot more evenly in my opinion
it makes it so that I don't have to add
a lot of oil to my skillet speaking of
skillet I've got my skillet here with
some olive oil in there you'll need
about three to four tablespoons for the
whole thing so I've got that preheating
in there over about medium heat
in the meantime I'm just going to use my
knife this is a knife I chopped up my
herbs with I'm going to use my knife and
I'm just going to cut this probably in
bite-sized pieces like so like I said
traditionally you sliced your potatoes
really thinly but I don't think it
really makes a difference but if that's
what you prefer by all means go for it
I'm just going to dice these up and get

onions that my oil is not really hot
yeah
and that's fine I want to add my onions
and my potatoes in there at the same

about medium heat this will cook for
about ten to fifteen minutes the

through because this is the only chance
you have to cook the potatoes themselves
so give them time stir them around that
olive oil is going to coat them really
well make sure nothing sticks and let
them cook for about 15 minutes or so
this just thrills me
okay these took about I would say a
little over 15 minutes it's going to

you don't have to do that but I just

don't have to flip this around because
it can be quite intimidating to flip

matter whisk your eggs add them right in
and what you're going to do is just turn
this up a little tiny bit what you're
going to do for a good six solid minute
or two is you can see I'm kind of
pushing the eggs throughout the entire
potato mixture that's important because
I want to make sure it's nice even
omelet frittata tortilla whatever you
want to call this and just do this for a

feel like it just cooks really evenly
that way and I'm going to cook this
until it's about three-quarters of the
